attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Ampharos, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Arcanine for each Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Fire Blow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine when you use this attack. If you do, flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Gluey Slime
abilities.text: As long as Ariados is in play, each player must pay an additional Colorless to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. Gluey Slime can't make a player pay more than an additional Colorless to retreat a Pokémon, even if there is more than 1 Ariados in play.

attacks.name: Spider Force
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage and the defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Bubble Turn
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Azumarill is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, return Azumarill and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

abilities.name: Flower Supplement
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Knife Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Entei, you must discard an Energy card attached to Entei. (Attach the Fire Energy, and then discard an Energy from Entei.)

attacks.name: Burning Fang
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Entei and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Happy Healing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, count the number of Energy attached to Blissey and then remove that many damage counters from the chosen Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Smash Bomber
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Super Dynamo
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Electrode is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Energy Return
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), choose an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and return it to your hand. This power can't be used if Espeon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Damage Blast
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom.

attacks.name: Dark Impact
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Super Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Discard any number of Energy cards attached to any of your Pokémon. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards discarded this way. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Called Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to Exeggutor. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Sleep Pendulum
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Hypno is your Active Pokémon, you may make the Defending Pokémon Asleep. This power can't be used if Hypno is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Aura
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Knocked Out by the damage from this attack, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it.

abilities.name: Fluff
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Jumpluff would be damaged or affected by an opponent's attack and it already has at least 1 damage counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack (including damage).

attacks.name: Cotton Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Water Cyclone
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water Energy card from your Active Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Kingdra is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rapids
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any.

abilities.name: Ion Coating
abilities.text: You may use this power once during each of your turns (before your attack). All Lightning Energy attached to your Active Pokémon becomes Water Energy for the rest of the turn. (This effect ends if your Active Pokémon retreats or is returned to your hand.) This power can't be used if Lanturn is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Electric Tackle
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Lanturn. Flip a coin. If tails, Lanturn does 10 damage to itself for each Lightning Energy attached to it.

abilities.name: Magnetic Flow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Magneton is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon that have Energy cards attached to them. Choose 1 of the Energy cards attached to each of those Pokémon and switch them between the Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Steel Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that are the same type (color) as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Earth Rage
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nidoking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Nidoking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Heavyweight
abilities.text: As long as there is a Grass Energy attached to Muk, you must pay an additional ColorlessColorless to retreat it.

attacks.name: Burning Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Grass Energy attached to Muk. If any of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Burned.

attacks.name: Miracle Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition (Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned). The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Poison Resistance
abilities.text: Scizor can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Snatch
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with no damage counters on it and switch the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Metal Energy attached to Scizor. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Suction Cups
abilities.text: As long as Octillery is your Active Pokémon, whenever the Defending Pokémon retreats, discard all Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon when it goes to the Bench.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Bursting Hand
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards there.

attacks.name: Shuffle Attack
attacks.text: Look at a number of cards on top of your opponent's deck equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. Put those cards in any order, and then put them back on top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Earth Rift
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, flip a coin. If tails, this attack can't be used during your next turn.

attacks.name: Iron Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. If 1 is heads and 1 is tails, this attack just does 50 damage.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Sudowoodo doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.)

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Sudowoodo. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Strange Tentacles
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), as long as the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon is less than the number of Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, you may choose an Energy card, if any, in your opponent's discard pile and attach it to the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tentacruel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Miracle Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), discard a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Togetic is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togetic is still Colorless.) Togetic performs that attack.

attacks.name: Destructive Roar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigacrush
attacks.text: Each player discards the top 3 cards from his or her deck.

abilities.name: Dark Moon
abilities.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon and has a Darkness Energy attached to it, once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose from it a number of cards up to the number of Darkness Energy attached to Umbreon and shuffle them into your opponent's deck. Your opponent then draws the same number of cards from his or her deck. This power can't be used if Umbreon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Fragrance Trap
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it. This Power can't be used if Victreebel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Corrosive Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Ampharos, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

abilities.name: Anti-Lightning
abilities.text: You can't attach Lightning Energy cards from your hand to Zapdos.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Zapdos.

attacks.name: Lightning Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on Zapdos.

attacks.name: Poison Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

attacks.name: Addictive Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Supporter cards during his or her next turn.

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Arcanine for each Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Fire Blow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine when you use this attack. If you do, flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each heads.

If heads, count the number of Energy attached to Blissey and then remove that many damage counters from the chosen Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

data.name: Elekid
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent moves that card to 1 of his or her other Pokémon. (If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Entei, you must discard an Energy card attached to Entei. (Attach the Fire Energy, and then discard an Energy from Entei.)

attacks.name: Burning Fang
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Entei and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom.

attacks.name: Dark Impact

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lateral Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to all of of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Backup
abilities.text: Once during each of your turns (before your attack), if you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, you may draw cards from your deck until you have 3 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rapture Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, remove 2 damage counters from Parasect.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Damage from this attack is reduced by 10 for each damage counter on Primeape.

attacks.name: Sudden Charge
attacks.text: Primeape does 10 damage to itself. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

abilities.name: Earth Rage
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nidoking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Nidoking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Quagsire but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash.

attacks.name: Gallop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Rapidash and this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Bursting Hand
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards there.

attacks.name: Shuffle Attack
attacks.text: Look at a number of cards on top of your opponent's deck equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. Put those cards in any order, and then put them back on top of your opponent's deck.

abilities.name: Dense Body
abilities.text: Any damage done to Slowbro by attacks from Basic Pokémon (excluding Baby Pokémon) is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Energy Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage for each Energy attached to Slowbro but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

abilities.text: Scizor can't be Poisoned.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 damage. If both are heads, this attack does 50 damage. If both are tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Bellsprout.

abilities.name: Scavenger Hunt
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 cards from your hand into your deck. Then, search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Furret is affected by a Special Condition.

abilities.name: Enervating Pollen
abilities.text: As long as Gloom is in play, Resistance on each player's Active Pokémon only reduces damage by 10.

attacks.name: Sleep Sap
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Attract
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Distortion Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Growlithe.

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Nidorino does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Pupitar does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Triple Bone
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Water Bullet
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Seadra. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Seaking.

attacks.name: Undulate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seaking.

abilities.name: Lightweight
abilities.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Skiploom for each Grass Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Break Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 10 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Smoochum
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Kiss
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Tyrogue
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Gooey Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to Weepinbell.

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Stretch Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Skedaddle
attacks.text: Return Aipom and all basic Energy cards attached to it to your hand. If you have no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poison Vine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Doduo.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Chinchou.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, switch Hitmontop with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Hitmonchan can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.text: Your opponent discards the top card from his or her deck. Then you remove a damage counter from Larvitar.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge

attacks.name: Baby Outing
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck, and then choose 1 of those cards and put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Attach 1 Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to Mareep.

attacks.name: Long Tongue
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Conductive Body
abilities.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Magnemite for each Magnemite on your Bench.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Magnemite does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Mug
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Energy Barrier
abilities.text: If Mr. Mime would be damaged by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 for each basic Energy card attached to Mr. Mime. The maximum amount of damage that can be reduced by Energy Barrier is 20.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Crush
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to Onix. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Spore Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Paras. Attach it to Paras. This counts as evolving Paras. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Ponyta.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Super Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Data Sort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Trainer card from your discard pile, show it to your opponent, and then shuffle it into your deck.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon is play. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for this attack.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Spy
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck. Put them back in the same order.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rob
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. Choose all Technical Machine and Pokémon Tool cards there and put them into his or her deck. Your opponent shuffles the deck afterward.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card. Show those cards to your opponent, and then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fishing Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, Evolution card, or basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and then put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Vulpix.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Fire Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Fire Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Fire Cube 01.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Tentacool in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Tentacool.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: Forest Guardian
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your deck. Then, look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose 1 of those cards and put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck afterward.

data.name: Lightning Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Lightning Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Lightning Cube 01.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to this Pokémon. Then, flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards discarded that way. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Juggler
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Discard up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand. If you discarded 1 basic Energy card, draw 3 cards. If you discarded 2 basic Energy cards, draw 5 cards.

attacks.name: Paint Trick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. Then, choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon and switch Smeargle with it.

attacks.name: Doublslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sharp Stinger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Apricorn Forest
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

Once during each player's turn (before attacking), if that player's Bench isn't full, that player flips a coin. If heads, that player shows his or her opponent a basic Energy card from his or her hand. Then, that player searches his or her deck for a Basic Pokémon card of the same type (color) as the revealed Energy card and puts it onto his or her Bench. The player shuffles his or her deck afterward.

data.name: Darkness Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Darkness Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Darkness Cube 01.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard any Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Fighting Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Fighting Pokémon in play. That Pokémon my use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Fighting Cube 01.

attacks.name: Violent Rage
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Healing Berry
rules: Attach Healing Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool card attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
At the end of any turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has 20 HP or less, remove 3 damage counters from that Pokémon and discard this card.

data.name: Grass Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Grass Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Grass Cube 01.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.name: Memory Berry
rules: Attach Memory Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card from which the Pokémon evolved. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) Discard this card at the end of any turn the Pokémon attacks.

data.name: Seer
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Look at the top 6 cards of your deck. Take all Basic Energy cards you find there, show them to your opponent, and then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Metal Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Metal Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Metal Cube 01.

attacks.name: Metal Reversal
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Pokémon Fan Club
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 2 Baby Pokémon and/or Basic Pokémon cards and put them onto your bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Psychic Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may us this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Psychic Cube 01.

attacks.name: Psy Confuse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Pokémon Park
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Once during each of his or her turns, whenever a player attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, he or she removes 1 damage counter, if any, from that Pokémon.

data.name: Super Energy Removal 2
rules: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, discard all Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. If both are tails, discard all Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon. If 1 is heads and 1 is tails, this card does nothing.

data.name: Traveling Salesman
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 2 Technical Machine and/or Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Undersea Ruins
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player chooses 1 of his or her Evolved Pokémon in play and discards the top Evolution card from that Pokémon, devolving it.

data.name: Water Cube 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Water Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Water Cube 01.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Weakness Guard
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard it at the end of your opponent's next turn.
As long as this card is attached, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Warp Energy
rules: Warp Energy provides 1 Colorless Energy. When you attach Warp Energy from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Time Shard
rules: Attach Time Shard to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool card attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from the Defending Pokémon's attack during your opponent's turn, you may return up to 2 basic Energy cards attached to that Pokémon to your hand.

data.name: Town Volunteers
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Take 5 Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, Evolution, and/or basic Energy cards from your discard pile and then show them to your opponent. Shuffle them into your deck.

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. At the end of every turn, put 1 damage counter on the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to, unless it's Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done to the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal, whenever it damages a Pokémon, reduce that damage by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Power Plant
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

Once during each of his or her turns, a player may discard a basic Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does, he or she chooses a basic Energy card from his or her discard pile, shows it to his or her opponent, and then puts it into his or her hand.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water, Lightning, or Psychic basic Energy card from your hand to Kingdra, Kingdra's type (color) becomes the same as that Energy card type until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Aquabomb
attacks.text: Kingdra does 10 damage to itself. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance when Kingdra damages itself with this attack.)

attacks.name: Dual Burn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each tails, discard 1 Energy card attached to Kingdra.

data.name: Boost Energy
rules: Boost Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon. Discard Boost Energy at the end of the turn it was attached. Boost Energy provides ColorlessColorlessColorless Energy. The Pokémon Boost Energy is attached to can't retreat. When the Pokémon Boost Energy is attached to is no longer an Evolved Pokémon, discard Boost Energy.

data.name: Crystal Energy
rules: Crystal Energy provides 1 Energy of all types (colors) of basic Energy cards attached to the Pokémon Crystal Energy is attached to. If there are no basic Energy cards attached to the Pokémon Crystal Energy is attached to, Crystal Energy provides Colorless Energy.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Fire, Water, or Psychic basic Energy card from your hand to Lugia, Lugia's type (color) becomes the same as that Energy card type until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steam Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Lugia.

abilities.name: Crystal Type
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Grass, Lightning, or Fire basic Energy card from your hand to Nidoking, Nidoking's type (color) becomes the same as that Energy card type until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Rolling Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin, If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
